meanings.definition: To formulate or plan in advance
meanings.sent1: I like to preformulate my study schedule before the semester starts.
meanings.sent2: She always preformulates her presentation outline to ensure it is well-organized.
meanings.sent3: Before the camping trip, we preformulated a list of essential items to pack.
meanings.sent4: The coach preformulated a winning strategy for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: It is wise to preformulate your goals to have a clear direction in life.

meanings.sent1: To avoid last-minute stress, it's helpful to preformulate your daily tasks.
meanings.sent2: The chef will preformulate the ingredients for tomorrow's special dish.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to preformulate a surprise party for their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The team preformulated a detailed plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: It's important to preformulate your travel itinerary to make the most of your trip.
